bill_title: require criminal record checks of certain school employees.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require criminal record checks of certain school employees. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 23-5-12.1 be amended to read as follows: 23-5-12.1. The superintendent of any public school or nonpublic school or the owner or operator of any child welfare agency as defined in § 26-6-1 may submit the name of any person being considered for employment by the school or agency , either directly or by contract, to the Division of Criminal Investigation for a criminal record check. If the division determines the person has a record of criminal convictions, the division shall notify the superintendent, owner, or operator of the criminal offenses. The division shall notify the owner or operator of the results of the criminal record check. Section 2. That chapter 13-10 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person being considered for employment by a school district, either directly or by contract, for a position that does not require certification pursuant to chapter 13-42 shall submit to a criminal record check as provided in § 23-5-12 as a condition of employment. The prospective employee shall sign the waiver set forth in § 23-5-12, be fingerprinted, and sign a declaration under penalty of perjury regarding any prior criminal conviction and military history. The prospective employee shall submit the fingerprints to the South Dakota Division of Criminal Investigation and the Federal Bureau of Investigation Identification Division. A report that contains information on the person's criminal history shall be made to the superintendent and the prospective employee. Any fees charged as part of the record check shall be borne by the prospective employee. A school board or governing body may employ a person conditionally while results of the check are pending. Section 3. That chapter 13-10 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person may be employed by a school district, either directly or by contract, if the person has been convicted of: (1) Murder; (2) Manslaughter; (3) Vehicular homicide; (4) Killing an unborn child by injury to the mother; (5) Assault; (6) Child abuse or neglect; (7) Kidnaping; (8) A sex offense as defined by chapter 22-22 or similar statutes from another state; (9) Indecent exposure; (10) Arson; (11) Robbery; (12) Abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an aged or disabled person; or (13) Possession or distribution of marijuana or a controlled substance. Section 4. That chapter 13-10 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: A superintendent may deny employment to a person who has been convicted of any crime involving moral turpitude or who has been convicted of any crime involving harmful behavior toward children. For purposes of this Act, conviction means a plea or verdict of guilty, a suspended sentence, or a conviction following a plea of nolo contendre in this state or any other state. In reviewing a misdemeanor conviction of an applicant, the superintendent may take into consideration, prior to denial, any information submitted by the applicant regarding the facts and circumstances surrounding a conviction, the type of offense and the sentence imposed, whether the act resulting in the conviction would constitute a crime in South Dakota, the date of the offense, the age of the applicant at the time of the offense, and the applicant's conduct and positive social contributions since the offense.
